text:
Has anyone experienced blog post body not displaying or even being editable?
`{{ content.post_body }}` does nothing :thinking_face:
Even went back to the 'stock boilerplate' blog post template.
Saw a comment mentioning it 2 years ago, but for him it just "magically solved itself the next day".

I attempted to copy the "blog content" module as well, but that broke more than it did good
{{ contet.name }} work fine; displays and is editable, but nothing for the .post_body
Shows up on the side bar, but clicking it does nothing
Have you tried update or publish? Or content|print to see if it is in there
Pprint
`{{content.post_body|pprint}}` gives:

While `{{content}}` gives this:
main issue is that there is no editorial things to press/activate in order to put content in
Try {{content|pprint}}
If the post_body is empty it's not in the database

That gives me this 'tiny' thing:
ctrl +f on "post_body":"
gives 2 results.
What happens if you create a new post
It's an empty div so no content
Just the same
HubSpot UI not giving me an option to add any content
Weird
Might be a bug then
It should show a box that lets you click and wdit
Edit
Yea - I saw it early on in the project, but something, somewhere seems to have broken it without giving an error
Another thing you could try is setting the value with HubL on the template... Only if a <http://dev.blog|dev.blog> thougj
Though

I have an older version of the blog made with an older, now deleted theme and here it displays - I have no idea how it still operates as it's original theme was deleted month ago, but here's the error differences between the two (tabbing between them).
<https://gyazo.com/1acaf6b2d1a1b0ced2019fea09993a92>

Only big remarks I find is that there is 1 extra error message in the newer one and the old (working) one doesn't get the theme-tab - which would make sense since it shouldn't exist anymore. Further increase the suspicion that there is something the newer theme is doing to break post_body - but what in the world could break that when the blog-post.html template is boilerplate stock x.x

On the verge of giving up I hit some luck.
I was on a path to manually add a rich-text module in the blog-post template to replace the {{ content.post_body }}, but when adding it in the darn thing starts showing up and being edtiable....

So whatever black magic stuff `{{ content.post_body }}` is doing; it needs some kind of reference/able to reach the rich text module - got knows why it doesn't.

```{% set template_css = "../../css/templates/blog.css" %}
{% extends "./layouts/base.html" %}```
Ì probably need to look into these
I'm sorry about this. It's like slaying a dragon and you don't know how or why it works.
Ahh nice

Does anyone have an example of how to use https request variables for hubl? I have a website page where I have an input field and ideally I would like to update the color variable like this:
 `{% set color= 'INPUT_FIELD_VARIABLE_HERE' %}`

It looks like that's not possible. So the best way would be to reload the page essentially? Anyone have any examples?

HubL can’t be re-processed without re-rendering the page — it’s a templating language, not a scripting language. By the time a page hits a user’s browser, all of the HubL has been 100% processed into HTML/CSS/JS.

If I’m understanding what you’re trying to do here, I think you’d be best off using a mix of JS, the LocalStorage API, and CSS variables to accomplish this.

You *can* set HubL values based on form submissions, by way of <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#http-request-variables|using >`request.query`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#http-request-variables|/>`request.query_dict`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#http-request-variables| to capture URL parameters>, but that *does* still require a reload and would be very difficult to preserve across pages.
Hmmm that's what I thought! I don't mind the page reload. I'm trying to grab the variable from the URL once it reloads, `<http://url.com?product=71201|url.com?product=71201>`
Any examples of request.query? I'm pulilng the product variable in now but still facing the same issue hubl not recognizing even after reload
`request.query_dict.product` should give you a result of `71201` in this case.
Ah! Got it thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
